medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with symptoms after one year post aortic and mitral valve replacement. Symptoms included fever with a temperature of 101Â°F and coldness in the right foot indicating diminished pulses. Her condition progressed with her left leg becoming cold and pulseless, leading to an urgent thromboendarterectomy for an acutely occluded femoral artery.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant past medical history includes rheumatic fever, gout, pulmonary hypertension, atrial fibrillation, congestive heart failure, and three prior valve operations.
medical_history.social_history: Significant social history includes ownership of pet finches.
